resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

BryanCutler commented on pull request #3449: ARROW-4180: [Java] Make CI tests use logback.xml
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3449#discussion_r249595097
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/travis_script_java.sh
 ##########
 @@ -27,7 +27,7 @@ if [ $ARROW_TRAVIS_JAVA_BUILD_ONLY == "1" ]; then
     # Save time and make build less verbose by skipping tests and style checks
     mvn -DskipTests=true -Dcheckstyle.skip=true -B install
 else
-    mvn -B install
+    mvn -B install -Dlogback.configurationFile=file:${ARROW_HOME}/java/dev/logback.xml
 
 Review comment:
   It doesn't look like it's able to find the logback file. You might try `$JAVA_DIR/dev/logback.xml`

fields.summary: [Java] Reduce verbose logging of ArrowBuf creation events?

comments.body:
+1 [~bryanc]

I guess the CI change isn't required for gandiva java (travis_script_gandiva_java.sh) because the tests are already picking up the config present in 

java/gandiva/src/test/resources/logback.xml
